articles.author: Tess Owen
articles.title: That ICE prison for transgender immigrants? It never opened.
articles.description: Now more trans women are being held in the general prison population

articles.author: Robin Urevich, Capital & Main
articles.title: What Happened at an Immigrant Detention Center While ICE Officials Looked the Other Way?
articles.description: Needing detention space, ICE has used noncompetitive contracts called Intergovernmental Service Agreements to quickly bring beds online. But is the government failing to impose accountability standards on its sprawling immigrant-prison system?

articles.author: Esther Lee
articles.title: Immigrants allegedly forced to work in detention centers for $1 a day
articles.description: Detainees held at a privately-operated immigration detention center in Georgia are forced to work at the facility for pitiful pay and are threatened with serious harm if they refuse to “volunteer” to work, according to a class-action lawsuit filed Tuesday aga…

articles.author: The Republic | azcentral.com, Daniel González, The Republic | azcentral.com
articles.title: Transgender women in migrant caravan face new struggles seeking asylum in U.S.
articles.description: Transgender migrants from Central America who traveled in a caravan through Mexico are now being held in a remote detention center in New Mexico.

articles.author: Meredith Hoffman
articles.title: Trump Sent Judges to the Border. Many Had Nothing to Do.
articles.description: The administration's plan to speed up deportations and reduce the immigration court backlog might be making things worse.
